page.title: 16The Methodist Church-Kirton
page.content: A short distance from the centre of the village,down Lndon Road,stands the Methodist Church,built with brick with a stone East End. It was built on this site at the beginning of the twentieth century;the original chapel had been on the opposite side of the road where a tyre firm now stands.John Wesley is believedto have preached in the eighteenth century. The minister lives nearby and travelr around taking other services in other Methodist Churches in the district.Services are held on Sundays,with a Sunday School for children. The two churches in the village work well,sharing moring service on the second and fourth Sunday of every month.Fund raising events are held to raise money for the church.
